{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=WRE54G |revision=v3 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=02/28/2006 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Gemtek |manuf_model=WACM-125G |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=repeater |fcc_id=Q87-WRE54GV3 |ic_id=3839A-WRE54GV3 |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn=AC |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88W8515 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=1 |fla1_brand=SST |fla1_model=39VF800A |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=8 |ram1_brand=ISSI |ram1_model=IS42S32200C1-6T |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8515 |wi1_chip2_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:18:F8,00:1E:E5,00:23:69,00:25:9C,68:7F:74 |oui_eth= }} ''Wireless-G Range Expander''
{{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=WRE54G}}, [http://www.linksysbycisco.com/UK/en/support/WRE54G Support page (UK)] OEM Gemtek WACM-125G v02 (WACM-125G_V00) WRE54G v3.0 serial numbers appear to start with '''MGB2'''. Device is on the DD-WRT [http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Known_incompatible_devices known incompatible devices list]. Per the FCC photos, the device does not use a barrel plug for power.
